intro: Leandra clidemioides subsp. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small fauna. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
